title: News for March, 2025
content:
[[include :scp-wiki:theme:newspaper]]
[[div class="pseudocrumbs" style="text-align: center"]]
**[[[news|Site News Hub]]]**
**Â« [[[news-02-2025|February 2025]]] | __[[[news-03-2025|March 2025]]]__ | [[[news-04-2025|April 2025]]] Â»**
[[/div]]

[[span class="placard"]][[size 75%]] **DISCLAIMER:** This is the Site News for the English Branch of the SCP Wiki. The opinions of the individual members of the Site News team that are presented in each edition of the Site News are their own thoughts and are not meant to be representative of the Site News team as a whole nor are they representative of the staff body as a whole. If you take issue with any of the contents, then feel free to reach out to the editor(s) and they will review the contents to see if there are any edits that need to be made. We intend to always deliver interesting content to you, and we understand that there may be times where controversial or unpopular opinions will be presented whether by our writers or our editor(s). Thank you for your understanding![[/size]][[/span]]

[[div class="anchor"]]
[[div class="tocbox"]]
[[div class="toc-u"]]
[[toc]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div_ class="breaker"]]
[[/div]]
[[div class="section-header"]]
+ Stories and Editorials
[[/div]]

[[=image https://scp-sandbox-3.wikidot.com/local--files/draftswap2025/recycle.png width="200px"]]
This year's spring cleaning event is almost upon us! Except this year, there is a twist. We will be hosting the very first official 19cord Draft Swap! How does it work? I'm glad you asked. 

Alice submits a draft. The drafts are scrambled around between participants, and Alice winds up with Bob's draft, which she now has a few weeks to complete and change however she sees fit. Posting is optional, so don't feel pressured to submit if you don't want to, but this is a great opportunity to make new friends and write outside of your comfort zone!

Draft Swap starts March 10th (hub goes up on the same day) and lasts until April 10th.


[[>]]
[[span class="s-title"]]//- By Uncle Nicolini//[[/span]]
[[/>]]


------

Hey all! As you might remember from the contest schedule earlier this year, there is an international contest coming up this month! Stay tuned at http://scp-int.wikidot.com/ to catch when it's released!

**Edit: Unfortunately the International Contest had to be delayed by a month. Check back next month!**

[[>]]
[[span class="s-title"]]//- By ParallelPotatoes//[[/span]]
[[/>]]
------
[[div class="section-header"]]
+ Writing and Art Prompts
[[/div]]

Site News is bringing you monthly writing and art prompts! Every month there will be user-submitted prompts to help inspire new pieces. Participation in these prompts is completely optional, and any pages based on the prompts will be featured in the next issue of Site News! If you're interested in submitting a prompt for next Site News, send a wikidot PM to [[*user ParallelPotatoes]] or [[*user ProblemPal]]. One prompt submission per person, and up to five prompts will be shown in each edition of Site News. 

This month's prompts are below! 

[[size x-large]]It's not gonna be good[[/size]] //Submitted by ParallelPotatoes//
Write a story where everything just gets worse.

[[size x-large]]Foundation Mundanity[[/size]] //Submitted by IndustryStandard//
Write a tale about something mundane that happens in the Foundation, like taking out the trash or paperwork!

If you write an entry inspired by this or a previous month's prompts, feel free to send a wikidot PM to [[*user ParallelPotatoes]] to have it featured in the next Site News! There isn't a time limit on getting prompt submissions featured, so feel free to write for a previous month's prompts as well! [[footnote]]Please note that in the event of an official contest, contest entries that were inspired by a Site News prompt will be featured the month after the contest ends.[[/footnote]]

------
[[div class="section-header"]]
+ Seminars
[[/div]]

[[size x-large]]Public Domain Contest Seminar! Sunday, March 23rd, 2025 2:00 PM EST
[[/size]]
Psi, Corax and Prismal will be digging up some graves for public domain con! We will be reading a few of the most popular works and discussing the contest in all of its forms. We will be discussing how our authors wrote for the contest, how they adapted for it, and our favorites!

All seminars are hosted on [[[https://discord.com/invite/scp|the official discord]]]!
------

[[div class="section-header"]]
+ Features Last Month
[[/div]]

[[=]]
+++ Top Articles of the Month
[[/=]]

Ratings of course do not mean everything, but they are representative of what people happened to like seeing at the time. With this in mind, the following are the top-rated works last month, so if by some chance you haven't encountered them yet, be sure to check them out!

[[div class="f-flex"]]
[[div class="f-con"]]

[[=]]
++++ Top-Rated SCP
[[/=]]

[[[SCP-8626|SCP-8626]]] by //IndustryStandard//: **children, who watch in silence**

{{As all known victims have encountered SCP-8626 under unmonitored circumstances during their early life,1 containment possibilities remain minimal..}}

[[/div]]
[[div class="f-con"]]

[[=]]
++++ Top-Rated Non-SCP
[[/=]]

[[[to-be-king-in-the-house-of-dust|To be King in the House of Dust]]] by //Intercedent//

{{Slayer of the Bull of Heaven, slayer of Humbaba, slayer of lions, the first hero, Mightiest Son, the god-man, ð’€­ð’„‘ð’‚†ð’ˆ¦.}}

[[/div]]

[[=]]
+++ Front Page Features
[[/=]]

Every month, an article is selected from each of the three common article types: SCP, Tale, and Group of Interest Format. These three articles are displayed on the front page for the month to bring further recognition to them.

------

[[=]]
+++ Reviewers' Spotlights
[[/=]]

Works are featured on the siteâ€™s front page as part of the Reviewersâ€™ Spotlight, which acknowledges the time and effort spent by forum reviewers helping other authors develop and edit and their works for the mainsite. Each month, community members are encouraged to nominate forum reviewers who have been both particularly helpful and active. Members of the Forum Criticism Team will then discuss the nominations, and select four prominent reviewers to choose the monthâ€™s Reviewersâ€™ Spotlight front-page features.

[[=]]
//If you would like to view previous spotlights, you can view the archive for them [[[reviewers-spotlight-archive | here]]]!//
[[/=]]

[[div class="f-con"]]

[[=]]
++++ 1st of February
[[/=]]

[[[SCP-8172|SCP-8172]]] by //Tsercele// [Featured by //zoempaws//]

{{SCP-8172 is a persistent reality-altering effect which prevents the United States Central Intelligence Agency (CIA) from engaging in occult warfare.}}

[[div class="f-con"]]

++++ 9th of February

++++ 17th of February
[[/=]]

++++ 25th of February
[[/=]]

[[[critter-profile-moonstone|Critter Profile: Moonstone!]]] by //xexnoncores// [Featured by //radian628//]

{{Moonstone came to us after a panicked call from a jewelry store owner in Little Havana who lost much of her stock from her ravenous appetite.}}

[[/div]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="section-header"]]
+ SCP Data & Trends
[[/div]]

Site News and Data Analysis teams are discontinuing the SCP Data & Trends section. Sorry for the inconvenience!

[[div class="section-header"]]
+ New Content this Month
[[/div]]

There is a multitude of wonderful works that are posted to the Wiki every month whether they be SCP articles, Tales, GoI Formats, Art pages, Author Pages, Essays, and more! Below, we have all of the creations for this month listed out by week and type (except for art pages, we did that earlier!) We have added little emojis next to articles that qualify to add some additional content. Below we have listed out the emojis we use and what they mean. Be sure to give them a look!

ðŸ¤ = **Co-authored works** - It is always interesting to see the dynamics of how people work together!
ðŸŒ = **International works** - Articles translated from one of our international branches!
ðŸ’¯ = **Articles rated at +100 and higher** - These are articles that have seen success and should be celebrated for it!
ðŸ“ˆ = **SCP articles rated under +30 and Tales and GoI Formats rated under +20** - Let's show these a little love!
